name: Hidaya Foundation
mission: PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL, SOCIAL WELFARE AND CHARITABLE ASSISTANCE TO ECONOMICALLY DEPRESSED AREAS
theoryOfChange: The Hidaya Foundation's strategic framework is articulated through its Mission and Programs sections. Their mission is to implement educational, environmental, social welfare, and healthcare programs in economically depressed areas of Asia, Africa, and North America, with a focus on projects that promote self-employment. Their priorities include educating the masses and spreading literacy, particularly among women, to bring about sustainable change in society, and focusing on future self-employment to break the cycle of ongoing dependency, while also providing immediate assistance. The foundation aims to provide a comprehensive solution that addresses the entire well-being of a child and a community, working in major areas such as Education, Social Welfare, Environment, Health Care, and Self Employment.

rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1999</cite>, the Hidaya Foundation is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="2">educational, social welfare, and charitable assistance</cite> to economically depressed regions. The organization operates with a highly efficient financial model, reporting <cite id="3">$15,472,301 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Their operational strategy is characterized by an <cite id="4">exceptional program expense ratio of 95.0%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions directly fund service delivery rather than administrative overhead. Hidaya maintains a broad international footprint, implementing programs across <cite id="5">Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, and several African nations</cite> including Somalia and Ethiopia. The foundation is <cite id="6">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, offering a structured platform for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through <cite id="7">specific asnaf categories such as the poor and needy</cite>. Beyond emergency relief, the organization invests in long-term stability through <cite id="8">self-employment schemes and healthcare initiatives</cite>, maintaining a lean fundraising operation that spends only <cite id="9">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite>.
